member.name: T:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes
member.summary: Setting used to restrict the abilities that potentially untrusted resources have.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.None
member.summary: No flag is set, everything is accepted.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.Navigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from navigating browsing contexts other than the sandboxed browsing context itself (or browsing contexts further nested inside it), auxiliary browsing contexts (which are protected by the sandboxed auxiliary navigation browsing context flag defined next), and the top-level browsing context (which is protected by the sandboxed top-level navigation browsing context flag defined below).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.AuxiliaryNavigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from creating new auxiliary browsing contexts, e.g. using the target attribute, or the window.open() method.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.TopLevelNavigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from navigating their top-level browsing context and prevents content from closing their top-level browsing context.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.Plugins
member.summary: This flag prevents content from instantiating plugins, whether using the embed element, the object element, the applet element, or through navigation of a nested browsing context, unless those plugins can be secured.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.Origin
member.summary: This flag forces content into a unique origin, thus preventing it from accessing other content from the same origin.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.Forms
member.summary: This flag blocks form submission.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.PointerLock
member.summary: This flag disables the Pointer Lock API.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.Scripts
member.summary: This flag blocks script execution.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.AutomaticFeatures
member.summary: This flag blocks features that trigger automatically, such as automatically playing a video or automatically focusing a form control.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.Fullscreen
member.summary: This flag prevents content from using the requestFullscreen() method.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.DocumentDomain
member.summary: This flag prevents content from using the document.domain feature to change the effective script origin.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.Sandboxes.Presentation
member.summary: This flag allows the sandboxed content to run presentational content.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Browser.TaskPriority
member.summary: Describes the various task priorities.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.TaskPriority.None
member.summary: The lowest possible priority.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.TaskPriority.Normal
member.summary: The normal priority.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.TaskPriority.Microtask
member.summary: Microtasks are preferred.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Browser.TaskPriority.Critical
member.summary: Critical tasks are always executed asap.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.FormExtensions

member.summary: Set the field values of given form by using the dictionary which contains name value pairs of input fields.
member.param: The fields to use as values.
What to do if some field(s) have not been found in the form. If true, then new input will be created. Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.FormExtensions.SubmitAsync(AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlFormElement,System.Object)
member.summary: Submits the given form by decomposing the object into a dictionary that contains its properties as name value pairs.
member.param: The fields to use as values.
member.returns: The task eventually resulting in the response.

member.summary: Submits the given form by using the dictionary which contains name value pairs of input fields to submit.
member.param: The fields to use as values.
What to do if some field(s) have not been found in the form. If true, then new input will be created. Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.
member.returns: The task eventually resulting in the response.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.FormExtensions.SubmitAsync(AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlElement,System.Object)
member.summary: Submits the form of the element by decomposing the object into a dictionary that contains its properties as name value pairs.
member.param: The element to submit its form.

member.returns: The task eventually resulting in the response.

member.returns: The task eventually resulting in the response.

member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern HTML attribute, containing a regular expression that the control's value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url or email; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlInputElement.Step
member.summary: Gets or sets the step HTML attribute, which works with min and max to limit the increments at which a numeric or date-time value can be set. It can be the string any or a positive floating point number. If this is not set to any, the control accepts only values at multiples of the step value greater than the minimum.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlInputElement.StepUp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increments the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified.
member.param: Optional: The number of steps to take.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlInputElement.StepDown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Decrements the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified.
member.param: Optional: The number of steps to take.

member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the beginning of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the first argument, and selectionEnd as the second argument.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlInputElement.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the end of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the second argument, and selectionStart as the first argument.

member.summary: Selects a range of text, and sets selectionStart and selectionEnd. If either argument is greater than the length of the value, it is treated as pointing to the end of the value. If end is less than start, then both are treated as the value of end.
member.param: Optional: The direction of the selection.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTableElement.InsertRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new empty row in the table. The new row is inserted immediately before and in the same section as the current indexth row in the table. If index is -1 or equal to the number of rows, the new row is appended. In addition, when the table is empty the row is inserted into a TBODY which is created and inserted into the table.
member.param: The row number where to insert a new row. This index starts from 0 and is relative to the logical order (not document order) of all the rows contained inside the table.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTableElement.RemoveRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a table row.
member.param: The index of the row to be deleted. This index starts from 0 and is relative to the logical order (not document order) of all the rows contained inside the table. If the index is -1 the last row in the table is deleted.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTableRowElement.InsertCellAt(System.Int32,AngleSharp.Html.Dom.TableCellKind)
member.summary: Insert an empty TD or TH cell into this row. If index is -1 or equal to the number of cells, the new cell is appended.
member.param: [Optional] The place to insert the cell, starting from 0. A negative value indicates that the cell should be appended to the row.
[Optional] The kind of table cell to insert.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTableRowElement.RemoveCellAt(System.Int32)

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTableSectionElement.InsertRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a row into this section. The new row is inserted immediately before the current indexth row in this section. If index is -1 or equal to the number of rows in this section, the new row is appended.
member.param: The row number where to insert a new row. This index starts from 0 and is relative only to the rows contained inside this section, not all the rows in the table.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTableSectionElement.RemoveRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a row from this section.
member.param: The index of the row to be deleted, or -1 to delete the last row. This index starts from 0 and is relative only to the rows contained inside this section, not all the rows in the table.

member.summary: Gets the direction in which selection occurred. This is "forward" if selection was performed in the start-to-end direction of the current locale, or "backward" for the opposite direction.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTextAreaElement.DirectionName
member.summary: Gets or sets the directionality of the form element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTextAreaElement.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the beginning of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the first argument, and selectionEnd as the second argument.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTextAreaElement.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the end of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the second argument, and selectionStart as the first argument.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTextAreaElement.SelectAll
member.summary: Selects the contents of the textarea.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IHtmlTextAreaElement.Select(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Selects a range of text, and sets selectionStart and selectionEnd. If either argument is greater than the length of the value, it is treated as pointing to the end of the value. If end is less than start, then both are treated as the value of end.
member.param: Optional: The direction of the selection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of content that is used to submit the form to the server. If specified, this attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.HtmlButtonElement.FormMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the method attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.summary: Gets or sets that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If specified, this attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.HtmlButtonElement.FormTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets A name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the target attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minlength HTML attribute, indicating the minimum number of characters the user can enter. This constraint is evaluated only when the value changes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current value in the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the placeholder HTML attribute, containing a hint to the user about what to enter in the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets if the field is required.

member.summary: Gets or sets if the textarea field is read-only.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.HtmlTextFormControlElement.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the beginning of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the first argument, and selectionEnd as the second argument.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.HtmlTextFormControlElement.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the end of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the second argument, and selectionStart as the first argument.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.HtmlTextFormControlElement.SelectionDirection
member.summary: Gets the direction in which selection occurred. This is "forward" if selection was performed in the start-to-end direction of the current locale, or "backward" for the opposite direction.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.HtmlTextFormControlElement.Select(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Selects a range of text, and sets selectionStart and selectionEnd. If either argument is greater than the length of the value, it is treated as pointing to the end of the value. If end is less than start, then both are treated as the value of end.
member.param: Optional: The direction of the selection.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.HtmlTextFormControlElement.SelectAll
member.summary: Selects the contents of the control.

member.summary: The text selection direction is unknown.

member.summary: The text is selected in forward direction.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState
member.summary: The ValidityState interface represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation. Together, they help explain why an element's value fails to validate, if it's not valid.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsValueMissing
member.summary: Gets if the element has a required attribute, but no value.

member.summary: Gets if the value is not in the required syntax (when type is email or url).

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsPatternMismatch
member.summary: Gets if the value does not match the specified pattern.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsTooLong
member.summary: Gets if the value exceeds the specified maxlength.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsTooShort
member.summary: Gets if the value is below the specified minlength.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsBadInput
member.summary: Gets if the value is regarded is invalid input.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsRangeUnderflow
member.summary: Gets if the value is less than the minimum specified by the min attribute.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsRangeOverflow
member.summary: Gets if the value is greater than the maximum specified by the max attribute.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsStepMismatch
member.summary: Gets if the value does not fit the rules determined by the step attribute (that is, it's not evenly divisible by the step value).

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsCustomError
member.summary: Gets the element's custom validity message.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Dom.IValidityState.IsValid
member.summary: Gets if the element meets all constraint validations, and is therefore considered to be valid.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions
member.summary: Contains a number of options for the HTML parser.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsEmbedded
member.summary: Gets or sets if the document is embedded.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsAcceptingCustomElementsEverywhere
member.summary: Gets or sets if custom elements can be used everywhere. Otherwise, custom elements can only be used in locations specified by the official W3C spec (e.g., in the body).

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsPreservingAttributeNames
member.summary: Gets or sets if attribute names should not be normalized. Usually, attribute names will be only seen lower-cased. When this option is activated, the names will be taken as-is.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsNotSupportingFrames
member.summary: Gets or sets if frames should not be supported. Once set this will ignore frame elements and respect noframes elements.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsScripting
member.summary: Gets or sets if scripting is allowed.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsStrictMode
member.summary: Gets or sets if errors should be treated as exceptions.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsSupportingProcessingInstructions
member.summary: Gets or sets if XML processing instructions should be parsed into DOM nodes.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsKeepingSourceReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets if references to the original source document should be kept on the elements in form of their tokens.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.IsNotConsumingCharacterReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets if the parsing of character references should be avoided. Note: With this option there is no way to determine from AngleSharp what character references have been fully valid vs. invalid.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.Parser.HtmlParserOptions.OnCreated
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback once a new element was created.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Io.Download

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames
member.summary: The collection of (known / used) header names.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.CacheControl
member.summary: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client or vice-versa whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds. e.g. Cache-Control: no-cache e.g. Cache-Control: max-age=3600

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Connection
member.summary: Options that are desired for the connection, e.g. Connection: keep-alive e.g. Connection: close

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the request/response body in octets (8-bit bytes), e.g. Content-Length: 348

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ContentMd5
member.summary: A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the response, e.g. Content-MD5: Q2hlY2sgSW50ZWdyaXR5IQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ContentType
member.summary: The MIME type of this content (only used with POST / PUT methods), e.g. Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded e.g. Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Date
member.summary: The date and time that the message was sent, e.g. Date: Tue, 15 Nov 1994 08:12:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Pragma
member.summary: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain, e.g. Pragma: no-cache

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Via
member.summary: Informs the client or server of proxies through which the response or request was sent, e.g. Via: 1.0 fred, 1.1 example.com (Apache/1.1)

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Warning
member.summary: A general warning about possible problems with the entity body, e.g. Warning: 199 Miscellaneous warning

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Accept
member.summary: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response, e.g. Accept: text/plain

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.AcceptCharset
member.summary: Character sets that are acceptable, e.g. Accept-Charset: utf-8

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.AcceptEncoding
member.summary: List of acceptable encodings. See HTTP compression, e.g. Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.AcceptLanguage
member.summary: List of acceptable human languages for response, e.g. Accept-Language: en-US

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.AcceptDatetime
member.summary: Acceptable version in time, e.g. Accept-Datetime: Thu, 31 May 2007 20:35:00 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Authorization
member.summary: Authentication credentials for HTTP authentication, e.g. Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Cookie
member.summary: An HTTP cookie previously sent by the server with Set-Cookie, e.g. Cookie: $Version=1; Skin=new;

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Expect
member.summary: Indicates that particular server behaviors are required by the client, e.g. Expect: 100-continue

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.From
member.summary: The email address of the user making the request, e.g. From: user@example.com

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Host
member.summary: The domain name of the server (for virtual hosting), and the TCP port number on which the server is listening. The port number may be omitted if the port is the standard port for the service requested. Mandatory since HTTP/1.1. Although domain name are specified as case-insensitive, it is not specified whether the contents of the Host field should be interpreted in a case-insensitive manner and in practice some implementations of virtual hosting interpret the contents of the Host field in a case-sensitive manner, e.g. Host: en.wikipedia.org:80

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.IfMatch
member.summary: Only perform the action if the client supplied entity matches the same entity on the server. This is mainly for methods like PUT to only update a resource if it has not been modified since the user last updated it, e.g. If-Match: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.IfModifiedSince
member.summary: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, e.g. If-Modified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.IfNoneMatch
member.summary: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, e.g. If-None-Match: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.IfRange
F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.IfUnmodifiedSince
member.summary: Only send the response if the entity has not been modified since a specific time, e.g. If-Unmodified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.MaxForwards
member.summary: Limit the number of times the message can be forwarded through proxies or gateways, e.g. Max-Forwards: 10

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Origin
F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ProxyAuthorization
member.summary: Authorization credentials for connecting to a proxy, e.g. Proxy-Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Range
member.summary: Request only part of an entity. Bytes are numbered from 0, e.g. Range: bytes=500-999

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Referer
member.summary: This is the address of the previous web page from which a link to the currently requested page was followed. (The word referrer is misspelled in the RFC as well as in most implementations.), e.g. Referer: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Te
member.summary: The transfer encodings the user agent is willing to accept: the same values as for the response header Transfer-Encoding can be used, plus the "trailers" value (related to the "chunked" transfer method) to notify the server it expects to receive additional headers (the trailers) after the last, zero-sized, chunk, e.g. TE: trailers, deflate

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Upgrade
member.summary: Ask the server to upgrade to another protocol, e.g. Upgrade: HTTP/2.0, SHTTP/1.3, IRC/6.9, RTA/x11

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent string of the user agent, e.g. User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:12.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/21.0

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.AccessControlAllowOrigin
member.summary: Specifying which web sites can participate in cross-origin resource sharing, e.g. Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.AcceptRanges
member.summary: What partial content range types this server supports, e.g. Accept-Ranges: bytes

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Age
member.summary: The age the object has been in a proxy cache in seconds, e.g. Age: 12

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Allow
member.summary: Valid actions for a specified resource. To be used for a 405 Method not allowed, e.g. Allow: GET, HEAD

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The type of encoding used on the data, e.g. Content-Encoding: gzip

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ContentLanguage
member.summary: The language the content is in, e.g. Content-Language: da

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ContentLocation
member.summary: An alternate location for the returned data, e.g. Content-Location: /index.htm

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ContentDisposition
member.summary: An opportunity to raise a "File Download" dialog box for a known MIME type with binary format or suggest a filename for dynamic content. Quotes are necessary with special characters, e.g. Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="fname.ext"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ContentRange
member.summary: Where in a full body message this partial message belongs, e.g. Content-Range: bytes 21010-47021/47022

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ETag
member.summary: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest, e.g. ETag: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Expires
member.summary: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale, e.g. Expires: Thu, 01 Dec 1994 16:00:00 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.LastModified
member.summary: The last modified date for the requested object, in RFC2822 format, e.g. Last-Modified: Tue, 15 Nov 1994 12:45:26 +0000

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Link
member.summary: Used to express a typed relationship with another resource, where the relation type is defined by RFC5988, e.g. Link: </feed>; rel="alternate"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Location
member.summary: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created, e.g. Location: http://www.w3.org/pub/WWW/People.html

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.P3p
member.summary: This header is supposed to set P3P policy, in the form of P3P:CP="your_compact_policy". However, P3P did not take off, most browsers have never fully implemented it, a lot of websites set this header with fake policy text, that was enough to fool browsers the existence of P3P policy and grant permissions for third party cookies, e.g. P3P: CP="This is not a P3P policy! See ... for more info."

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.ProxyAuthenticate
member.summary: Request authentication to access the proxy, e.g. Proxy-Authenticate: Basic

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Refresh
member.summary: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created. This refresh redirects after 5 seconds, e.g. Refresh: 5; url=http://www.w3.org/pub/WWW/People.html

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.RetryAfter
member.summary: If an entity is temporarily unavailable, this instructs the client to try again after a specified period of time (in seconds), e.g. Retry-After: 120

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Server
member.summary: A name for the server, e.g. Server: Apache/2.4.1 (Unix)

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.SetCookie
member.summary: An HTTP cookie, e.g. Set-Cookie: UserID=JohnDoe; Max-Age=3600; Version=1

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Status
member.summary: The HTTP status of the response. "Status" is not listed as a registered header. The "Status-Line" of a "Response" is defined by RFC2616 without any explicit Status: header name, e.g. Status: 200 OK

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.StrictTransportSecurity
member.summary: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains, e.g. Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=16070400; includeSubDomains

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Trailer
member.summary: The Trailer general field value indicates that the given set of header fields is present in the trailer of a message encoded with chunked transfer-coding, e.g. Trailer: Max-Forwards

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.TransferEncoding
member.summary: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity, e.g. Transfer-Encoding: chunked

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.Vary
member.summary: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server, e.g. Vary: *

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Io.HeaderNames.WwwAuthenticate
member.summary: Indicates the authentication scheme that should be used to access the requested entity, e.g. WWW-Authenticate: Basic

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.StringExtensions.UrlEncode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Replaces characters in names and values that should not be in URL values. Replaces the bytes 0x20 (U+0020 SPACE if interpreted as ASCII) with a single 0x2B byte ("+" (U+002B) character if interpreted as ASCII). If a byte is not in the range 0x2A, 0x2D, 0x2E, 0x30 to 0x39, 0x41 to 0x5A, 0x5F, 0x61 to 0x7A, it is replaced with its hexadecimal value (zero-padded if necessary), starting with the percent sign.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.StringExtensions.UrlDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the provided percent encoded string. An exception is thrown in case of an invalid input value.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.StringExtensions.NormalizeLineEndings(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces every occurrence of a "CR" (U+000D) character not followed by a "LF" (U+000A) character, and every occurrence of a "LF" (U+000A) character not preceded by a "CR" (U+000D) character, by a two-character string consisting of a U+000D CARRIAGE RETURN "CRLF" (U+000A) character pair.

member.summary: Converts the current string to one of the form methods.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition
member.summary: The position in the source code.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.Empty
member.summary: An empty position (0, 0, 0).

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.#ctor(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new text position.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.Line
member.summary: Gets the line within the document. The line is 1-based, so the first line has value 1.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.Column
member.summary: Gets the column within the document. The column is 1-based, so the first column has value 1.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.Position
member.summary: Gets the position within the source. The position is 1-based, so the first character is at position 1.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.Index
member.summary: Gets the index within the source. The index is 0-based, so the first character is at index 0.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.Shift(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new text position that includes the given offset.
member.param: The number of columns to shift.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.After(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns a new text position that is after the given character.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.After(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a new text position that is after the given string.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the position in the text.
member.returns: A string that contains the contained line and column.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: An integer that is the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.
member.param: The object to compare with the current instance.
member.returns: True if the given object is a text position with the same values, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.Equals(AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current position is equal to the given position.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.
member.returns: True if the given position has the same values, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.op_GreaterThan(AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition,AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition)
member.summary: Compares the two positions by their absolute positions in the text source.
member.returns: True if the position of the first operand is greater than the second operand.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.op_LessThan(AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition,AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition)
member.summary: Compares the two positions by their absolute positions in the text source.
member.returns: True if the position of the first operand is less than the second operand.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition.CompareTo(AngleSharp.Text.TextPosition)
member.summary: Compares the current position with another position.
member.returns: A mathematical representation of the relation (1 = greater, -1 = less, 0 = equal).

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange
member.summary: The positional range in the source code.

member.summary: Creates a new text range.

member.summary: Gets the start position of the range.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange.End
member.summary: Gets the end position of the range.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the range in the text.
member.returns: A string that contains the start and end positions.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: An integer that is the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.
member.param: The object to compare with the current instance.
member.returns: True if the given object is a text position with the same values, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange.Equals(AngleSharp.Text.TextRange)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current range is equal to the given range.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.
member.returns: True if the given range has the same start and end position, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange.op_GreaterThan(AngleSharp.Text.TextRange,AngleSharp.Text.TextRange)
member.summary: Compares the two ranges by their positions in the text source.
member.returns: True if the start position of the first operand is greater than the end position of the second operand.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange.op_LessThan(AngleSharp.Text.TextRange,AngleSharp.Text.TextRange)
member.summary: Compares the two ranges by their positions in the text source.
member.returns: True if the end position of the first operand is less than the start position of the second operand.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.TextRange.CompareTo(AngleSharp.Text.TextRange)
member.summary: Compares the current range with another range.
member.returns: A mathematical representation of the relation (1 = greater, -1 = less, 0 = equal).

member.summary: Creates a new text source from a string. No underlying stream will be used.

member.summary: Gets the full text buffer.

member.summary: Checks if the given char is a valid character.
member.returns: True if the char would indeed be valid.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Text.XmlExtensions.IsValidAsCharRef(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the given integer would be a valid character.
